item.title: PostGIS - Installation
item.description: Installation Update APT package list and upgrade system Prerequisite: PostgreSQL will need to be installed and configured beforehand. sudo apt update sudo apt -y upgrade -y switch basically means automatic yes to prompts; assume “yes” as answer to all prompts and run non-interactively Add UbuntuGIS-unstable repository & update sudo add-apt-repository ppa:ubuntugis/ppa sudo apt-get update Install PostGIS sudo apt install postgis postgresql-12.1-postgis-3.0.0 replace the postgresql version with your own

item.title: PostgreSQL - Setup & Installation
item.description: Installing PostgreSQL Prerequisite: Make sure to have Ubuntu set up first. Using apt package manager, install Postgres (it's in the default Ubuntu repo). $ sudo apt update $ sudo apt install postgresql postgresql-contrib Postgres associates roles with a matching Unix/Linux system account. So let's Switch over to the postgres account on your server by typing: $ sudo -i -u postgres postgres: this user is the superuser for the PostgreSQL instance
